BiblioData.Title: LOW THERMAL DISTORTION SILICONE COMPOSITE MOLDS
BiblioData.Abstract: The present invention provides compositions and methods that may be used to form low thermal distortion molds. The composition may include a curable elastomeric silicone composition formed using a de-volatilized polymer and at least one de-volatilized cross-linker. One embodiment of the method may include forming a pattern on a first side of an elastomer that is impregnated with a fibrous material proximate a second side of the elastomer.

Claims.P: CLAIMS
WHAT IS CLAIMED:
1. A composition, comprising: a curable elastomeric silicone composition formed using a de-volatilized polymer and at least one de-volatilized cross-linker.
2. The composition of claim 1, wherein the de-volatilized polymer comprises a polymer exposed to at least one of a vacuum and heat to remove volatiles from the polymer.
3. The composition of claim 2, wherein the de-volatilized polymer comprises a de- volatilized vinyl functional siloxane polymer.
4. The composition of claim 1, wherein the de -volatilized cross-linker comprises a cross- linker exposed to at least one of a vacuum and heat to remove volatiles from the cross-linker.
5. The composition of claim 4, wherein said at least one de-volatilized cross-linker comprises a de-volatilized methyl hydrogen siloxane polymer with SiH functional groups.
6. The composition of claim 1, comprising at least one inhibitor.
7. The composition of claim 6, wherein said at least one inhibitor comprises 2-phenyl-3- butyn-2-ol (PBO).
8. The composition of claim 6, comprising at least one catalyst.
9. The composition of claim 8, wherein the catalyst has a concentration of 0.1 to 1000 ppm and the inhibitor has a concentration of about 0 to 10 wt.%.
10. A method, comprising: forming a pattern on a first side of an elastomer, the elastomer being impregnated with a fibrous material proximate a second side of the elastomer.
11. The method of claim 10, comprising impregnating the elastomer with the fibrous material.
12. The method of claim 11, wherein impregnating the elastomer comprises depositing a curable silicon-containing composition in or on the fibrous material.

13. The method of claim 12, wherein depositing the curable silicon-containing composition in or on the fibrous material comprises depositing the curable silicon-containing composition in or on a glass fabric comprising a plurality of glass fibers in a plurality of openings therebetween.

14. The method of claim 11 , wherein forming the pattern in the elastomer comprises: contacting a portion of the curable silicon-containing composition with a master pattern; curing, at least partially, the silicon-containing composition; and removing the master pattern from contact with the at least partially cured silicon- containing composition.
15. The method of claim 14, comprising curing the at least partially cured silicon- containing composition to form the elastomer.
16. The method of claim 15, comprising forming a pattern on a substrate using the pattern formed in the elastomer.

17. A method, comprising : forming a fiber-reinforced film that is at least partially cured; and forming a pattern in an elastomer, a portion of the elastomer being adjacent the fiber- reinforced film.

18. The method of claim 17, wherein forming the fiber-reinforced film comprises: forming a first layer of a silicon-containing composition; positioning a fibrous material such that a first side of the fibrous material is adjacent to the first layer; forming a second layer of the silicon-containing composition adjacent a second side of the fibrous material, the second side being opposite the first side; and curing, at least partially, the first and second layers.
19. The method of claim 18, wherein forming the first layer comprises forming the first layer using a silicone resin.

20. The method of claim 17, wherein forming the first layer comprises forming the first layer using a curable elastomeric silicone composition formed using a de-volatilized polymer and at least one de -volatilized cross-linker.
21. The method of claim 17, wherein positioning the fibrous material comprises positioning a glass fabric comprising a plurality of glass fibers and a plurality of openings therebetween.
22. The method of claim 17, wherein forming the pattern in the elastomer comprises depositing a curable silicon-containing composition adjacent a portion of the fiber-reinforced film.

23. The method of claim 22, wherein depositing the curable silicon-containing composition comprises depositing composition including a silicone resin and a cross-linker adjacent the portion of the fiber-reinforced film.

24. The method of claim 22, wherein forming the pattern in the elastomer comprises: contacting a portion of the curable silicon-containing composition with a master pattern; curing, at least partially, the silicon-containing composition; and removing the master pattern from contact with the at least partially cured silicon- containing composition.
25. The method of claim 17, comprising curing the fiber-reinforced film and the elastomer.
26. The method of claim 25, comprising forming a pattern on a substrate using the pattern formed in the cured elastomer.
27. A method, comprising: forming a rigid silicone resin film; and forming a pattern in an elastomer, a portion of the elastomer being adjacent the rigid silicone resin film.
28. The method of claim 27, wherein forming the rigid silicone resin film comprises depositing a curable composition over a substrate.
29. The method of claim 28, wherein depositing the curable composition comprises depositing a curable composition comprising a silicone resin.
30. The method of claim 29, comprising curing the curable composition.
31. The method of claim 27, wherein forming the pattern in the elastomer comprises depositing a curable silicon-containing composition adjacent a portion of the rigid silicone resin film.

32. The method of claim 31, wherein depositing the curable silicon-containing composition comprises depositing composition including a silicone resin and a cross-linker adjacent the portion of the rigid silicone resin film.

33. The method of claim 31 , wherein forming the pattern in the elastomer comprises: contacting a portion of the curable silicon-containing composition with a master pattern; curing, at least partially, the silicon-containing composition; and removing the master pattern from contact with the at least partially cured silicon- containing composition.
34. The method of claim 33, comprising forming a pattern on a substrate using the pattern formed in the elastomer.
